components.description:
A small piece of candy wrapped in plastic or wax paper with twists on its ends. Shape and color vary widely by platform. Facebook’s design used to resemble a classic unwrapped red-and-white peppermint. May also be called sweets or lollies.

This emoji tends to spike in use around Halloween.
components.title: Candy

description:
A small piece of candy wrapped in plastic or wax paper with twists on its ends. Shape and color vary widely by platform. Facebook’s design used to resemble a classic unwrapped red-and-white peppermint. May also be called sweets or lollies.

title: Candy

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A wrapped piece of sugar candy, often a treat for children. May be given at Halloween when kids are trick-or-treating. Known as sweets or lo http://emojipedia.org/candy/
emoji_net_data.name: candy

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00091091v: To eat a snack or light meal.
To eat small things in between meals.

bn:01456584n: Dubble Bubble is a brand of pink-colored bubblegum invented by Walter Diemer, an accountant at Philadelphia based Fleer Chewing Gum Company, in 1928.

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:00010746n: The term "collation" originates in the Roman Catholic Church, where it refers to the two small meals allowed on days of fasting, with or without abstinence.

bn:00015227n: A rich, sweet, food item made of flavored sugar and often combined with fruit or nuts; a confection, comfit.
Edible, sweet-tasting confectionery containing sugar, or sometimes artificial sweeteners, and often flavored with fruit, chocolate, nuts, herbs and spices, or artificial flavors.
A rich sweet made of flavored sugar and often combined with fruit or nuts
An edible, sweet-tasting confection containing sugar.
Candy, also called sweets or lollies, is a confection that features sugar as a principal ingredient.
